result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thad Edward Pouk was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes:
Jail time to commence upon termination or completion of Veteran's Court. 11/30/16 Court orders jail sentence to commence by 1/4/17 at 1:00 pm, with Huber to include Dane County for work purposes. 
2/2/17 Huber approved for up to 14 hours per day. 
2/6/17 Huber approved for up to 14 hours per day for work, PO or VA counseling in Rock and Dane Counties.

Defendant Thad Edward Pouk in court with attorney Robert D Junig, Jr..  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea entered on count 1, court adjudicates guilty, count 2 dismissed. Presentence investigation waived freely & voluntarily. Veterns court contract filed. CREDIT: 1 day if revoked. Felony warnings given.

Court accepts waiver & binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed; Copy to Defendant; Reading waived.  Defendant stands mute; Not Guilty Plea entered by Court; Jury Trial to be set, Court modifies bond conditions
No violent contact or disorderly conduct with victim B.P.;   Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or after consuming alcohol. Absolute sobriety.
